boardgame.name: Mercanti di Venere
Merchant of Venus
Merchant of Venus (second edition)
金星の商人
boardgame.description: Merchant of Venus uses many elements that come together to form a very interesting game. Players take on the roles of space traders who move their ships through interconnected systems discovering new alien worlds to trade with. As players start to make money delivering commodities in a unique supply-and-demand system, their earnings can be used to purchase better ships and equipment (shields, lasers, engines, etc...) and construct their own spaceports (which speed up trading) and factories (which create better commodities). Variations included in the rulebook allow for interplayer combat. The player who first acquires enough total value ($1000, $2000, $3000, $4000) in cash and port/factory deeds takes the day._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;For the 2012 edition of Merchant of Venus from Fantasy Flight Games, the company promises that this revision _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;remains true to its magnificently campy core while updating the map and game components and expanding game play in surprising ways that will cause even the most hardcore fan to celebrate._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; That said, the player count has been lowered from six (in the Avalon Hill edition) to four, with the four races in the game being Human, Whynom, Qossuth, and Eeepeeep._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

1-4 players (Fantasy Flight Games) Languages: English
Merchant of Venus (second edition) English second edition Publisher: Fantasy Flight Games

Fantasy Flight Games (FFGVA85) The galaxy is bursting with opportunities for savvy space traders to exploit, and the race to profit blasts off in Merchant of Venus. Discover new alien cultures and learn where you can get rich selling their goods in this board game of interstellar trade and exploration for 2-4 players. From your First Contact with alien cultures to the establishment of trade routes and spaceports, your quest for cash demands you keep on the move. Successful traders will quickly locate fast and reliable trade routes, timing their purchases and sales with the interest in the market. This revision of the 1980_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s classic remains true to its magnificently campy core while expanding the game in surprising ways that will cause even the most hardcore fan to celebrate. Space traders, get your ships ready for launch because it_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_#039;s time to engage in some wild entrepreneurship!

This game was initially purchased during the Fantasy Flight Christmas Sale, as a _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Ding and Dent_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; item. One corner on the bottom edge of the box is notably crushed, but this is primarily cosmetic and the structural integrity of the box is unaffected. The turn tracker piece is missing (it was tiny and likely a victim of cat tampering), but all other pieces are present and accounted for. Apart from the box damage and this missing piece, the game is essentially new. This also includes the Daedalus insert, assembled and in the box. One part of the insert (covering the culture tokens and not required for setting up/playing the game) shows some warping, but does not significantly impact function. Pictures furnished on request.
